misdeed: A series of strange occurrences has left the inhabitants of a riverside village on edge.  Unexplained hoofprints appear overnight, leading to and from the water's edge, and travelers report fleeting glimpses of a majestic white horse that vanishes like mist.
solution: The Vaesen is a Brook Horse and can be banished by riding it across plowed ground in the shape of a sun cross or leading it into a stable marked with six Christian symbols.

clues.description: The hoofprints are abnormally large, unlike those of any horse known in the area.
The river seems to flow unnaturally fast, its waters churning and swirling, even on calm days.
A local fisherman claims to have snagged a silver bridle in his net, but it burned his hand with an icy cold and slipped back into the depths.
Children report hearing a horse whinnying from the river at night, its voice both beautiful and terrifying.
The water level in the river drops significantly during the night, revealing strange symbols etched into the riverbed.
A local historian discovers a legend about a water spirit who takes the form of a horse, luring people to their deaths in the river's depths.

plotTwist.description: A young woman, mourning the death of her beloved horse, unknowingly summoned the Vaesen with her grief, seeking a replacement for her lost companion.
